item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, March 17, 2025 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Deep Learning Is Not So Mysterious or Different (20 points | discuss)
2. Launching RDAP; sunsetting WHOIS (752 points | 298 comments)
3. Ogres Are Cool (56 points | 17 comments)
4. Chaos in the Cloudflare Lisbon Office (108 points | 35 comments)
5. Extracting content from an LCP "protected" ePub (55 points | 10 comments)
6. Piramidal (YC W24) is hiring a ML Engineer to decode brainwaves ( | hide)
7. Raspberry Pi RP2350 Now Available for Purchase, Stacked Memory Variant Coming (98 points | 38 comments)
8. The exceptional Jordan algebra (2020) (81 points | 10 comments)

10. Undergraduate Disproves 40-Year-Old Conjecture, Invents New Kind of Hash Table (96 points | 36 comments)
11. Compression of Spectral Images Using Spectral JPEG XL (59 points | 11 comments)

13. HTTP/3 is everywhere but nowhere (205 points | 188 comments)
14. Conducting forensics of mobile devices to find signs of a potential compromise (119 points | 24 comments)
15. Underware 2.0 – Open Source Infinite Cable Management (31 points | 11 comments)
16. Genomic study: our capacity for language emerged at least 135k years ago (68 points | 39 comments)
17. Going down the rabbit hole of Git's new bundle-URI (256 points | 81 comments)
18. Coq-of-rust: Formal verification tool for Rust (26 points | discuss)
19. Checkers written in Rust and exported to WASM (79 points | 32 comments)
20. Image Processing in C – Dwayne Phillips [pdf] (104 points | 17 comments)
21. The Alexa feature "do not send voice recordings" you enabled no longer available (757 points | 510 comments)
22. Converting C to ASM to specs and then to a working Z/80 Speccy tape (58 points | 61 comments)
23. Akira ransomware can be cracked with sixteen RTX 4090 GPUs in around ten hours (70 points | 21 comments)
24. Docs – Open source alternative to Notion or Outline (1702 points | 425 comments)
25. Zlib-rs is faster than C (300 points | 410 comments)
26. Teach, Don't Tell (2013) (195 points | 63 comments)
27. When the Dotcom Bubble Burst (248 points | 256 comments)
28. Did the Particle Go Through the Two Slits, or Did the Wave Function? (189 points | 248 comments)
29. Artificial photosynthesis directed toward organic synthesis (60 points | 14 comments)
30. That Time I Recreated Photoshop in C++ (278 points | 133 comments)
